answers.text: the personal union of the United Kingdom and Hanover

qas.question: What was the name of William IV's heir?
Who did the throne of Hanover pass to instead of Queen Victoria?
What happened to the kingdom of Hanover in 1866?
In which battle was the Hanover army destroyed?

plausible_answers.text: Hanover could be inherited only by male heirs

qas.question: Why did the political ties between United Kingdom in Hanover and?
What was the name of William IV son
Who annexed the kingdom of Hanover in 1766?
Who is Hanover expected to lose to at the battle of Langensalza?
Who did the people of Hanover generally support after the annexation?

context: In 1837, <a0_0>the personal union of the United Kingdom and Hanover<a0_0/> ended because William IV's heir in the United Kingdom was female (<a1_0>Queen Victoria<a1_0/>). <b5_0>Hanover could be inherited only by male heirs<b5_0/>. Thus, Hanover passed to William IV's brother, <a2_0><b6_0>Ernest Augustus<a2_0/>,<b6_0/> and remained a kingdom until 1866, when it was <a3_0>annexed by <b7_0>Prussia<b7_0/><a3_0/> during the Austro-Prussian war. Despite being expected to defeat Prussia at the <a4_0>Battle of Langensalza<a4_0/>, <b8_0>Prussia<b8_0/> employed Moltke the Elder's Kesselschlacht order of battle to instead destroy the Hanoverian army. The city of Hanover became the capital of the Prussian Province of Hanover. After the annexation, the people of Hanover generally opposed the <b9_0>Prussian government<b9_0/>.
